~Proficiency in Religion~.Effect: Add your Level to Checks for knowing about religions, praying, performing sermons, faith, etc.

~Awe~.Effect:
Instantly heal or damage a target for 1d4 (True damage).
Some other Cleric spells will cast Awe for free, even if it is on Cooldown.

~Chains~.Effect:
Cast Awe on a target 4 times (for free).
It must pass a Might Check or be Paralyzed until it breaks free.
~Chains~.Notes: A Paralyzed creature must skip its turn. It makes a Might Check at the end of its every turn. If it succeeds, it breaks the Paralysis.

~March Ahead~.Effect:
All allies can move 3 extra meters on their next turn (and you too this turn).
After casting this, you can continue your movement.

~Piety~.Effect: Casting Awe yourself (manually, the actual Ability) now does 2d4 instead of 1d4.

<Eternal Bindings>.Effect:
A creature within 3 meters makes a Wisdom Check.
If it fails, cast Awe on it.
It becomes magically bound to an object within 3 meters of it and can't willingly move more than 3 meters away from that object.
It rolls the Check again at the start end of their turn to escape the binding.
Lasts up to 1 minute.

<Heavy Burden>.Effect:
A creature within 3 meters makes a Wisdom Check.
If it fails, cast Awe on it and it is Crippled.

<Repentance>.Effect: Restore 50% of another ally's maximum health, then cast Awe on yourself.
<Repentance>.Notes: You can't cast this if it would get you to 0 or less Health.

<War Smite>.Effect:
When you land an attack, roll 1d4 again and again until your roll 1.
Add them all together, and add the total to the attack.

<Shadow Realm>.Effect:
A Unit within 6 meters becomes trapped in a Shadow Realm with you for 2 rounds (this and the next).
Your attacks against it cast Awe on it for free while inside the Shadow Realm.
Neither of you can interact with the outside world, but can feintly see it.
Units on the outside can faintly see the two of you, as if you were ghosts.
<Shadow Realm>.Notes: The Shadow Realm is a copy of the normal world, but with no other units.

<Holy Apex>.Effect:
Declare a 6x6 meter area.
A giant spectral fist hits the ground and attacks all Units there except you for 2d10 + (Round Number d6) True damage (against Defense).
<Holy Apex>.Notes: E.g. on the first round of combat, this deals 2d10 + 1d6. Second round - 2d10 + 2d6. Third round - 2d10 + 3d6. And so on. Cover is applied from above if needed.

~Grasp~.Range: 15 meters (you don't need line of sight)
~Grasp~.Effect:
Cast Awe on the target twice.
That target can not benefit from Cover for 1 minute.
~Grasp~.Notes: If the target has Cover on attacks from any source, the Cover is negated (e.g. no more -2). Includes attacks while prone, attacks through jeavy wind, etc.

~Radiance~.Effect:
At all times, you radiate light in a 3 meter radius.
You can turn this on and off at will.
You are immune to being Blinded.
If you have full health, Awe damage and healing is 1d6.

~Twilight~.Effect:
You have Dark Vision.
You are immune to being Feared.
If you have 50% or less health, Awe damage and healing is 1d6.

<Let There Be Light>.Effect:
Grasp now casts Awe 3 times instead of 1.
You can also split your Grasp to target up to 3 targets, distributing the Awe casts as you like between them.
<Let There Be Light>.Notes: Splitting your Grasp means you cast (Grasp's) Awe on up to 3 targets, and each is affected by the Cover negation. For example, you can also choose to target 2 targets (e.g. one with 1 Awe and one with 2 Awe).

<Let There Be Darkness>.Effect:
You create a 6x6 meter area of magical darkness.
All attacks done from and towards units in the area have Cover.

<Circle of Awe>.Effect:
Declare a 4x4 area within 6 meters.
Now, and at the start of your next turn, cast Awe on all Units inside the area.

<Black Hole>.Effect:
You create a 1x1 Black Hole on an empty space.
Cast Grasp for free on all enemies within 6 meters of the hole.
If a Unit gets to the center of the Black Hole, it must pass a Might Check or be Rooted.
At the end of your turn, all Units within 6 meters of it are pulled 2 meters towards it.
The gravity of the black hole works even through walls and obstacles.
<Black Hole>.Notes: If 2 Units would be pulled to the center, you choose which.

~Second Soul~.Effect:
You have another character beside you, your 'minion', that is either a celestial or an undead.
Its stat block is dictated by your starting Ability choice below.

~True Necromancy~.Effect:
Your minion is a reanimated humanoid, whose soul is compelled to stay in this plane until its purpose is met.

The minion draws power from your own spirit: it shares the same {Health} Health pool with you (e.g. whenever one of you takes damage, the other one takes it as well). It also always has the same {Defense} Defense and Checks as you, and has Speed equal to your base Speed.
Your minion has a 1-Handed Melee weapon. On its turn, it can attack once with it for 1d8 {Damage} Damage without any Stat modifiers, regardless of the weapon's real damage. It does, however, apply weapon effects.
It takes its turn at the same time as you.

On your turn, you can also cast any Spell through your Minion for range purposes only.
~True Necromancy~.Notes:
Instead of attacking, your minion can do the equivalent of a Half-Action for non-combat uses, like using a potion, throwing a rope, reloading a weapon, etc, but not using a scroll. It can also use Disengage or Dash.
If both of you take damage at the same time (e.g. from an AoE effect), the damage taken is equal to the average of the damages taken.
It needs to rest and drink water normally, but does not require food.
Come up with a story about why you have an Undead minion and why your god allowed this or gave him or her to you. Your undead minion might still be sentient (or not; your choice). If it is sentient, your GM might allow it to speak multiple languages, depending on the plot and theme of the campaign. The GM might also allow it to have separate Stats from yours using the normal Stat distribution, for Check purposes only (e.g. it won't affect Health). Alternatively, you can choose your minion to be an animal (for aesthetic purposes only).

~Celestial Follower~.Effect:
Your minion is an angelic being, whose task is to protect guide or follow you until its purpose is met and is always by your side in the form of a spirit nobody else can interact with. Your Celestial follower can be a humanoid or animal in appearance (it can't fly) and is sentient.
Using 0 Actions, you can summon your minion in the physical plane, materializing in a space you choose within 5 meters, and lasts up to 3 turns.

It has {Health} Health equal to 10 + Your Level + Your Charisma, 3 {Defense} Defense, 5 Speed, 0 Initiative and the same Stats are you for Check purposes.
On its turn, it can attack, either Melee for 2d6 True {Damage} Damage, or ranged for 1d10 True {Damage} Damage (6 meters range).
Alternatively, on its turn, instead of Attacking, it can cast Awe once for free (with your current Awe dice tier, if it's not 1d4).

It takes its turn separately, and always has 0 Initiative.
~Celestial Follower~.Notes:
The Celestial Follower dematerializes after it finishes taking its 3rd turn.
Instead of attacking, your minion can do the equivalent of a Half-Action for non-combat uses, like using a potion, throwing a rope, reloading a weapon, etc, but not using a scroll. It can also use Disengage or Dash.
You can choose the aspect of your minion (e.g. sentient humanoid, animal, etc).
Come up with a story about why you have an angel follower.

<Divine Message>.Effect:
You pray for 10 minutes to get an answer to a question from your god(s).
Set a real life timer of 10 minutes (time in which you can do anything out of the game).
When the timer expires, you can ask the DM one question consisting of maximum 3 words (e.g. 'Is sword cursed?').
The answer you will get will consist of maximum 3 words.
The DM can choose not to answer, to answer falsely or say something completely different. The gods' wills are unknowable.

<Life Echo>.Effect:
You put a Life Echo on another ally.
Whenever YOU heal a different Unit, the unit with the Life Echo on them is also healed for 50% of that amount.
Lasts 1 minute.

<Dazzling Essence>.Effect:
Your follower's first Spell or Attack every encounter attempts to also Daze the target (against a Might Check).
Whenever you drop to (or below) 50% Health, this effect resets this encounter.

<Cleric Lich Ritual>.Effect:
You spend 24 hours in a special place of power (this could be a temple or given to you by your DM).
After it's finished, you become a Lich, and you are considered Undead.
Apply the following:
- You are Undead, thus immune to Charm, Fear and being put to Sleep
- You can no longer cast Generic Abilities that don't cost Mana, but gain 2 extra maximum Mana. Passive Spells that don't cost Mana still apply.
- You no longer need to eat, drink or sleep.
- You gain access to the Elemental and Eldritch Spell Lists.
- The range of all your Spells is doubled.
- Your Health decreases by 3
You also gain the following abilities:
- Phylactery
- Dismorphment
<Cleric Lich Ritual>.Upgrade:
At Level 5, your Defense increases by 1.
At Level 6, the range of all your Spells is doubled.
At Level 7, Counter Check Grade increases by 1.
At Level 8, all your Checks increase by 1.

~Phylactery~.Effect:
When you become a Lich, you place your soul inside a Phylactery - a special object, dear to you.
When you would reach 0 Health, instead of going Fallen, you can instantly teleport your body inside the Phylactery.
A spellcaster can channel during a whole Long Rest to resummon you near the Phylactery with full Health, Spells, etc.
If the Phylactery is destroyed, you must wait 1 year to make another one.
~Phylactery~.Notes: The Long Rest still applies to the channeler who revives you, and to you as well.

~Dismorphment~.Effect:
When a Unit declares an attack or Spell on you, you can instantly teleport up to 3 meters away.
That Unit can keep their action or change it.
You can also instantly teleport using 0 Actions on your turn.
~Dismorphment~.Notes: Remember that at Level 6, the range of this becomes 6 as per the description of Cleric Lich Ritual.

~Death Pact~.Effect:
Choose an ally (or yourself).
They lose 5 Health. You gain 1 Mana this turn only.

~Proficiency in Nature~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for identifying plants, knowing about nature and the wilds, etc.

~Druidcraft~.Effect:
You speak Druidic, an ancient form of conveying information through nature.
You can create harmless sensory effects or tiny weather effects (6 meters range).
You can massively speed up the growth of small plants (touch range).
You can slightly soothe physical pains (with no combat effect) (touch range).
You can attempt to convey simple ideas to animals and plants (3 meters range) that you would not normally be able to convey.
You have +3 on rolls for identifying plants.
You can do these even while Shapeshifted.

~Shapeshift~.Effect:
Pick an animal from the Pets and Animals list and instantly transform into it.
As soon as you Shapeshift, you can perform an Animal Attack!

For Checks, you can choose to use the animal's Stats or your Stats.
You also gain its exact abilities and Animal Attack (see below), but can't cast Spells.
Your Health stays the same, but you use that animal's Defense.

Shapeshift ends if you drop to 0 Health, and you Fall.
~Shapeshift~.Upgrade:
At first, you can't fly, even if your animal can. If your animal can fly, you have Proficiency in Jumping and you can glide (you don't take falling damage).
From Level 3, you can use this 3 times per Long Rest.
From Level 6, you can use this 4 times per Long Rest and you can fly.
From Level 9, you can use this 5 times per Long Rest.
~Shapeshift~.Notes:
You can't make attacks with ranged weapons while Shapeshifted (obviously).
You choose what items you keep on you when Shapeshifting, and those items are 'merged' into your new form.
You can turn back into your humanoid form for 0 Actions (on your turn).
While Shapeshifted, you can speak, but your voice is changed to match your shape (e.g. guttural for lions, high pitched for birds, etc).

~Animal Attack~.Effect: Make a melee attack for 1d8 + your Main Stat (not the animal's).

~Day Night Cycle~.Effect:
Instead of knowing one set of spells, as normal, you know two: one for the moon, and one for the sun.
The Moon spells can only be used at night (from end of dusk until start of dawn).
The Sun spells can only be used at day (from start of dawn until end of dusk).
The Sun spell set and the Moon spell set can not contain any of the same spell.
~Day Night Cycle~.Notes: So, in total, you know twice as many Spells.
~Day Night Cycle~.Downside: Once you Learn a spell for Day or Night, you can no longer assign it to the other one. Ever.

~Moonsun Fire~.Effect:
A target within 6 meters makes a Wisdom Check.
If it fails, it takes 1d6 + Main Stat Fire Damage and is Crippled (if day) or True damage and is Silenced (if night).
It takes half of that damage if it passes.
If you use this at night, you can't use it until day, and vice versa.

<Old Ritualist>.Effect:
Regain up to 3 Mana.
The Old Ritual must be performed outdoors, in a safe, uncorrupted place untouched by regular folk.
<Old Ritualist>.Downside: You lose the Shapeshift ability, and you can't choose upcoming Talents that improve Shapeshift.
<Old Ritualist>.Notes: You can't have more than your maximum amount of Mana.

<Improved Moonsun Fire>.Effect:
If day, Moonsun Fire also burns the target for 10% of its total Health as Fire damage.
If night, Moonsun Fire heals a target you choose within 6 meters for the same damage dealt.

<Lycanthropy>.Effect: During the night (24:00 to 6:00) you can Shapeshift into a Lycanthrope (see Lycanthrope form) when using Shapeshift.

<Druid Animal Companion>.Effect:
You have an animal pet that can fight alongside you, your Mana pool is permanently decreased by 1, and your total Health by 5.
Your animal has stats depending on its species. Check out the Pets and Animals page to see its stats!
Your pet takes its turn at the same time as you do, and always has the same initiative as yours.
Your pet has 1 Action per turn, which it can use to do its own Abilities.
Your pet can make normal Checks using using its own Stats.
Your pet will not stray more than 30 meters away from you in hostile territory.
All pets have the Pet Attack ability.
<Druid Animal Companion>.Upgrade: If your pet drops to 0 Health, it becomes Fallen, like a player. It has no reserve Health, but at any point outside of combat, you (the pet owner) can spend 30 minutes to tend to your pet's wounds and heal it back to full Health.
<Druid Animal Companion>.Notes:
If your pet raises from being Fallen, it has Pet Exhaustion (is Slowed and can only use Pet Attack, but all Pet Attacks have Cover, which is a -2 to the attack).
Treat your pet like a real companion - give it a name and care for it. If it ever dies, you can spend 2 days looking for another wild animal and taming it to become your new pet.

<Pet Attack>.Effect:
The pet melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d6 + 2 Pierce or Slash Damage (your choice).

<Regrowth>.Effect: Heal a Unit within 6 meters for 1d8 for each 10 Health it is missing.

<Sunrise/Moonfall>.Effect: Moonsun Fire now hits all Units within a 4x4 area you choose and deals an extra 2d4 Damage.

<Equinox>.Effect:
If it's day, choose a number of Units within 15 meters equal to your Main Stat.
They must pass a Wisdom Check or they forget to how to use ranged attacks or spells for 1 turn.
If it's night, your next Spell (this turn or next turn) casts twice.

~Wild Shape~.Effect:
When you use Shapeshift, you can transform into a combination of 2 animals.
You take the highest stat from both animals, and you have access to both of their abilities.
~Wild Shape~.Notes:
For example, you could transform into a combination of Bird of Prey and Bear, resulting in a kind of Owlbear, with a lot of health and a lot of Defense! Be creative!
The animal size is either the larger or the smaller of the two - your choice.
Even if you Shapeshift into 2 combinations of a same animal, the cooldown of that animal's Ability persists (e.g. you can't use Bear's Maul twice per Long Rest, no matter what animal combination you transform into).

<Forest Friend>.Effect:
You have a Pixie companion, a very small humanoid with wings.
The Pixie has 10 Defense, 1 HP, 5 Movement Speed.
It takes its turn at the same time as you and it has a Half-Action on its turn.
It can't attack with weapons, but it can use scrolls and potions.
Every Long Rest, you can teach it one Spell that costs a Half-Action from any Spell List and it can cast it once for a Half-Action until the next Long Rest (ignoring the Cost).
If the Pixie goes more than 50 meters away from you, it becomes unsummoned (you can summon it back by channeling for 10 minuets).
The Pixie has Charisma, Wisdom and Intelligence equal to yours, but its Dexterity is 0 and its Might is -5.
Decide with your DM whether you or the DM controls the Pixie roleplay-wise.
Have fun!
<Forest Friend>.Notes: The Pixie can stay in your backpack or pocket if you don't want it to take damage.

<Treesposition>.Effect:
Touch a large or larger piece of wood and choose one of the following:
1. Teleport near another large or larger piece of wood within 5 meters.
2. Partially enter the piece of wood, becoming camouflaged. You have +5 Stealth until you exit back to your normal space.
You can stay like that for up to 1 hour.
You benefit from Cover while inside a tree.
As a Reaction, you can use this when you are attacked or right when someone casts a spell (before the roll).

<Exotic Shapeshift>.Effect:
You can now Shapeshift into Exotic Animals.
You can also use Shapeshift to also transform into other people.
When you want to do this, roll a Deception check.
This check determines how close you get to the form of that person (12 or more means a perfect copy).
This copy just mimicks the look of the person, not the voice or personality.
<Exotic Shapeshift>.Notes:
You can cast your own spells while transformed into someone else.
Other people are not considered Animals, so you can't use Wild Shape to transform into a combination of a person and an Animal.

<Shapeshift Ally>.Effect:
Passively, you get 2 more uses of Shapeshift per Long Rest.
Choose a willing ally within 6 meters and Shapeshift them into an standard animal of your choice.
They have Animal Attack and all of the animal's Abilities.
They can cancel it for 0 Actions on their turn.

<Beastly Stamina>.Effect: For each animal, you gain an extra use of their Long Rest Abilities (per Long Rest).

~Eldritch Spells.Effect:
You can also learn Spells from the Eldritch Spell List and you know 3 extra Eldritch Abilities.
If a Spell costs Mana to cast, you can cast it with Blood Magic.
~Eldritch Spells.Notes: You can change the 3 extra Abilities from the Eldritch Spell List on a Long Rest.

~Blood Magic~.Effect: Choose a Generic Ability. If it costs nothing, take 6 Damage or otherwise take 6 damage for each Mana point it costs. Cast that spell regardless of its Cost and Cooldown. You can instead spend 6 Health to cast Black Charm.

~Black Charm~.Effect:
Choose a target.
At the start of your next turn, it must pass a Wisdom Check or be Stunned and take 2d8 Psychic damage.
If it passes, it takes half of the damage.

<Future Blood>.Effect:
Blood Magic can now draw Health from your Reserve Health Pool.
Your Reserve Health Pool increases by 8.

~Circle of the Land~.Effect:
You know 2 more Spells from the Nature spell list.
When you transform into an animal native to your domain, heal for 1d4 health (the GM has the final word on whether the animal fits your domain).
Choose one domain from: Mountains, Forest, Sea and Desert. Choose one of the Abilities below corresponding to your domain:

~Raise Wall~.Effect:
You raise a wall of stone, dirt or other such material from the ground, 1x3x2 (1 meter thick, 3 wide, 2 tall).
Enemies hit directly by the wall growing from below them take 1d6 Smash damage.
~Raise Wall~.Notes:
You can instantly crumble the wall on your turn by using 0 Actions.
You can't raise a wall under another wall, but you can cast this Spell twice to grow a wall twice as tall.

~Wild Roots~.Effect:
Roots spawn from your position (next to you) and travel up to 10 meters.
You control how the roots travel (they 'move' like a normal Unit).
All Units they pass through take 2d8 Pierce damage and must pass a Dexterity Check or be Rooted.
~Wild Roots~.Notes:
The roots can climb walls and over surfaces, using normal movement, but can't jump.
Ignores Cover, but be careful with pathing.

~Storm~.Effect:
Target a 4x4x4 meter area and create a storm there.
Creatures inside the sand storm are Blinded and the storm acts as hard terrain.
On your turn, you can use a Half-Action to move the Storm up to 2 meters in any direction.
Lasts 1 minute.

~Endurance~.Effect: You gain +1 on all Combat Checks and +5 to your maximum Health.

<Innervate>.Effect: Heal an ally for 3 Health and it regains 1 Mana or resets the Cooldown of an Ability.
<Innervate>.Downside: Can not be cast on Druids.

<Dazzling Miasma>.Effect:
Shoot a tainted gust of spores in a 10x1 meter line from your position.
It hits the first 2 Units it travels into.
If you hit one Unit, it must pass a Might Check or take 4d10 Poison damage (or half of that if it passes).
If you hit 2 Units, they must pass a Might Check or be Stunned and take 1d10 Poison damage (or half of that if they pass).

<Animate Plants>.Effect:
Choose 3 plants you can see. They become animated and fight for you.
The Abilities and stats of the plant depends on what type of plant it is (see the Pets page).
You don't control your plants; they attack the closest enemy to them, or use their Ability when they can.
When a Plant reaches 0 Health, it doesn't die, but it becomes de-animated.
Pick the plant type from the Druid Plants list that fits the plant the best.
Lasts up to 10 minutes.

~Proficiency in Hearing~.Effect: Add your Level to all Wisdom Checks for hearing (e.g. over-hearing dialogue, noticing unusual sounds, discerning sounds, etc).

~Proficiency in Smelling~.Effect: Add your Level to all Wisdom Checks for sensing smells and identifying things based on their smell.

~Slay~.Effect:
You always know the type of a monster.
You gain a different bonus when fighting an enemy of a certain type:
Monstrosities: Attacks against Monstrosities ignore half of the Defense.
Beasts: You have +1 Defense and +1 to all Combat Checks against Beasts.
Fiends: Your attacks against Fiends ignore damage resistances (but not immunities).
Undead: You have +2 Counter Check Grade against Undead.

~Tumble~.Effect: Move 1 meter in any direction, without triggering attacks of oportunity.

~Tracker~.Effect:
You can more easily track creatures and when you try to track a creature, your roll for that try gains +3. If you succeed, you may learn about its size, how many of them there are, if it's injured or roughly how far away it is.
Your party can't get lost in the wild except by magical means
You (and your pets) are unaffected by Difficult Terrain.

~Hunter Mark~.Effect:
Choose and mark a target.
Your own single target attacks (against Defense) against the marked target have the damage dice increased by 1 tier.
Last up to 10 minutes.
~Hunter Mark~.Notes:
Increasing dice by 1 tier means, for example, d6 become d8, or d10 become d12.
D12's and d20's don't increase.
Your pets' attacks don't increase.

<Animal Companion>.Effect:
You have an animal pet that can fight alongside you!
Your animal has stats depending on its species. Check out the Pets and Animals page to see its stats!
Your pet takes its turn at the same time as you do, and always has the same initiative as yours.
Your pet has 1 Action per turn, which it can use to do its own Abilities.
Your pet can make normal Checks using using its own Stats.
Your pet will not stray more than 30 meters away from you in hostile territory.
All pets have the Pet Attack ability.
<Animal Companion>.Upgrade: If your pet drops to 0 Health, it becomes Fallen, like a player. It has no reserve Health, but at any point outside of combat, you (the pet owner) can spend 30 minutes to tend to your pet's wounds and heal it back to full Health.
<Animal Companion>.Notes:
If your pet raises from being Fallen, it has Pet Exhaustion (is Slowed and can only use Pet Attack, but all Pet Attacks have Cover, which is a -2 to the attack).
Treat your pet like a real companion - give it a name and care for it. If it ever dies, you can spend 2 days looking for another wild animal and taming it to become your new pet.

<Crosshair Shot>.Effect:
Make an attack on a target.
For each meter to the target, the attack deals 1d6 Pierce damage, up to 8 meters.
For each meter to the target over 8 meters, deal one less d6.
<Crosshair Shot>.Notes: At exactly 8 meters range, the attack deals 8d6 damage. At 7 and 9 meters, it deals 7d6. At 6 and 10 meters, 6d6. And so on.

<Running Mark>.Effect:
You can use Tumble one more time per Long Rest.
Immediately after you Tumble, you can freely use Hunter Mark, ignoring its Cooldown.

<Tremor Wave>.Effect:
Shoot a thundering shot towards an obstacle or wall. A quaking wave travels horizontally towards in both directions of the wall up to 10 meters in each direction.
All Units within 2 meters of that wall must pass a Might Check or be Stunned and take 3d4 Shock damage.
They take half the damage and are Slowed if they pass.
<Tremor Wave>.Notes: The floor and ceiling are not considered a wall. The wave does not travel through them. This is considered a Spell. Ignores Cover.

~Warden~.Effect:
When you become a Warden, choose a Spell List from Bloodshed, Elemental, Divine, Arcane.
You now have access to that spell school as well, permanently (this can not be changed).
You have 2 extra special Warden Mana that you can only spend on Abilities from that chosen List and on Quick Magic.
Also, you can Know a number of extra Abilities equal to your Intelligence (at least 0).
~Warden~.Upgrade: At Level 4 you gain 1 extra Warden Mana, and again at Level 8.
~Warden~.Notes: Warden Mana replenishes on Long Rests.

~Quick Magic~.Effect:
Spend any amount of Mana.
Choose one of the following effects, then apply the exact same effect for each Mana spent:
- Instantly deal 1d4 Fire, Frost or Shock damage to a target, and permanently reduce its Defense by 1 (3 meter range).
- Instantly heal a target for 1d4 (3 meter range).
- Instantly dash 3 meters, ignoring attacks of oportunity, and going through enemies and small obstacles or medium gaps.

<Watcher Form>.Effect:
You take on a special form, called a Watcher Form.
Your body becomes engulfed in a magical aura (you choose its color), your eyes glow, and you can gain other aesthetics-only body transformations (customize it with your DM).
While in this form, your first Attack deals +1d8 damage once per turn, you gain +2 Counter Check Grade and +2 to all Combat Checks.
Also, when you cast a spell (before you do; excluding this), you can instantly dash 3 meters, ignoring attacks of oportunity, and going through enemies and small obstacles or medium gaps.
Lasts up to 1 minute.

<Combo Set>.Effect: You gain Quickfire, Parry and Tumblestrike.

<Quickfire (Hunter)>.Effect:
Perform an attack with a 1-Handed weapon.
This attack ignores Cover and has no pentaly if you're Blinded.
This attack does not trigger attacks of oportunity and can be used in melee range without penalty if it's a ranged weapon.

<Parry>.Effect: When a Unit declares a melee attack with a weapon on you (before you see the roll), you can block this attack and it deals 0 damage.

<Tumblestrike>.Effect: After you Tumble or Parry, your next Attack has the dice tiers increased.
<Tumblestrike>.Notes:
For example, instead of 2d6, an attack would be 2d8.
D12's and d20's don't increase; they stay d12 and d20.
This only affects Attacks. If an Ability tells you to Attack, then it applies.
For example, Quick Magic is not an attack.

<Warden Corral>.Effect:
Declare a 6x6 meter zone and it becomes engulfed in a special magical aura.
All Units have their Defense quartered (25%) while in that zone.
The zone lasts until the start of your next turn.

<Wind Wall>.Effect:
Use when an enemy or enemy group declares an attack.
Create a 4x4 meter wall of powerful Wind that destroys all projectiles.
It can't be passed through from the direction it is facing towards.
Lasts for 1 minute.
<Wind Wall>.Notes:
The wall pushes objects or willing Units away from it and can be used as a platform.
If you decide to place it horizontally, it acts as Hard Terrain.

<Improved Slay>.Effect:
Your Slay bonuses against enemies improve and are now the following:
Monstrosities: Attacks against Monstrosities ignore 75% of the Defense.
Beasts: You have +2 Defense and +2 to all Combat Checks against Beasts.
Fiends: Your attacks against Fiends ignore damage resistances and immunities.
Undead: You have +3 Counter Check Grade against Undead.

~Animal Companion~.Effect:
You have an animal pet that can fight alongside you!
Your animal has stats depending on its species. Check out the Pets and Animals page to see its stats!
Your pet takes its turn at the same time as you do, and always has the same initiative as yours.
Your pet has 1 Action per turn, which it can use to do its own Abilities.
Your pet can make normal Checks using using its own Stats.
Your pet will not stray more than 30 meters away from you in hostile territory.
All pets have the Pet Attack ability.
~Animal Companion~.Upgrade: If your pet drops to 0 Health, it becomes Fallen, like a player. It has no reserve Health, but at any point outside of combat, you (the pet owner) can spend 30 minutes to tend to your pet's wounds and heal it back to full Health.
~Animal Companion~.Notes:
If your pet raises from being Fallen, it has Pet Exhaustion (is Slowed and can only use Pet Attack, but all Pet Attacks have Cover, which is a -2 to the attack).
Treat your pet like a real companion - give it a name and care for it. If it ever dies, you can spend 2 days looking for another wild animal and taming it to become your new pet.

~Pet Attack~.Effect:
The pet melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d6 + 2 Pierce of Slash Damage (your choice).

<Second Companion>.Effect:
You have one more Animal Companion, aside from the one you get from your Beastmaster Companion.
This Animal Companion obeys the same rules as the regular one.

<Exotic Trainer>.Effect: Instead of your normal pets, you can choose from the Exotic list of pets.

<Ravage!>.Effect:
Your pet makes a melee Attack for 4d8 Slash damage.
Deals Main Stat extra damage if the target is below 50% Health.
The target can't regain Health until the end of combat
<Ravage!>.Notes: This takes 1 Action from YOU, not your pet.

<Sickem>.Effect:
Use when a Unit goes flying against its will.
Your pet(s) within 5 meters of its landing place can dash to it (after it lands) and make a total of 3 Pet Attacks on it.
<Sickem>.Notes:
Goes flying means is pushed, knocked up, dragged, etc.
This uses YOUR Reaction, not your pets'.
Obviously, the pets need line of sight and can't jump through walls, or over large obstacles. Apply common sense.

~Proficiency in General Knowledge~.Effect: Add your Level to all Intelligence Checks for knowing various simple facts about science, astronomy, trades, etc.

~Proficiency in Arcane~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks related to magic (e.g. identifying spells, magic items or runes, knowledge about magic, etc).

~Magic Mastery~.Effect:
The next ability you use that has the cost of 1 Action now costs a Half-Action.
This is not considered a Spell.

~Charisma Caster~.Effect: You can freely use Charisma as your Main Stat, if you choose to do so.

~Innate Magic~.Effect: When you cast a spell, if it's different than the previous spell you casted, the previous spell goes on a Long Rest Cooldown, even if it does not have a Cooldown by default.
~Innate Magic~.Notes: Example: 3 turns in a row, you cast Fire Bolt; next turn, you cast Magic Missiles; after this, you can't cast Fire Bolt again until the next Long Rest.

~Overcharge~.Effect:
After you cast a spell the 3rd time in a row, your next ability benefits from Magic Mastery.
After this, that spell becomes goes on a Long Rest Cooldown (and can't be used until the next Long Rest).

<Eldritch Specialization>.Effect: You gain access to the Eldritch Spell List, and when you cast an Eldritch Spell, you can choose to split the d8's into 2d4's and d12's into 2d6's.
<Eldritch Specialization>.Notes:
For example, if a Spell deals 2d8 damage, that becomes 4d4.
It might sound like the same thing, but because of math, 4d4 is actually, on average, 1 extra damage compared to 2d8.

<Wild Cast>.Effect:
Roll 1d6 and 1d8. This spell has the effect of the 2 combined rolls.
For the 1d6:
1. Attack a target for 3d6 Fire Damage
2. A target must pass a Dexterity Check or take 2d8 Cold Damage (or half if it passes).
3. Target all Units in a 4x4 area. Attack them all for 2d6 + 2 Shock Damage.
4. Two Units instantly take 6 Force Damage.
5. Attack all units in a 6x1 line from your position for 4d4 Pierce Damage.
6. One Unit you choose takes 1d10 Force Damage and is pushed 3 meters away from you.
For the 1d8:
1. Nothing else happens.
2. Target(s) all take an extra 2d6 Damage (directly) of the damage type of the 1d6 effect..
3. Target(s) must pass an Dexterity Check or be Rooted.
4. Target(s) must pass an Dexterity Check or be Crippled.
5. Target(s) must pass an Intelligence Check or be Silenced.
6. Target(s) must pass a Wisdom Check or be Feared.
7. Target(s) must pass a Wisdom Check or be Dazed.
8. Target(s) must pass a Might Check or be Stunned.

<Wild Magic>.Effect:
Whenever you spend Mana, roll 1d12.
If you roll 12, something wild happens!

<Arcane Comet>.Effect:
Shoot a comet that changes in power the longer it travels - it attacks and Crowd Controls a target.
It deals 1d4 Force damage (against Defense) for every meter it travels (up to 8d4).
However, the longer it travels, the weaker it's Crowd Control is.
Apply the following Crowd Control (directly) to the target depending on the distance traveled (distance between you and the target):
- 1 or 2 meters: Stun
- 3 or 4 meters: Daze
- 5 or 6 meters: Root
- 7 or 8 meters: None

<Star Burst>.Effect:
Declare up to 4 different targets within 15 meters.
Assign a different number from #1 to #4 to each.
Roll (3 + Main Stat) d4's. Each number deals that much Shock damage to the target with that number.
Each rolled 1 deals 1 damage to target number #1.
Each rolled 2 deals 2 damage to target number #2.
And so on.
<Star Burst>.Notes:
E.g. if you put #2 on a goblin, and you roll three 2's on the d4's, then that goblin takes 6 Force damage.
You should probably assign the higher number to the target you want to do most damage to.
You can declare fewer targets, but then the missing number will deal damage to no target.
Cover is applied normally.

<Honorificabilitudinitatibus>.Effect: Your single-target Spells that deal half damage when a target passes a Check now deal the full damage regardless.
<Honorificabilitudinitatibus>.Notes: That means spells like Acid Burst don't even require a Check anymore.

~Spell Book~.Effect:
You have a special Spell Book.
Each Long Rest, you can Learn one extra Spell you can Know that costs 1 Mana.
You can cast this Spell once until the next Long Rest, without using Mana.
~Spell Book~.Notes: You should tell your party and Game Master what Spell you chose ahead of time.

~Magic Expertise~.Effect: You can cast Level 4 spells from Level 1, and Level 8 spells from Level 4.

<Counterspell>.Effect: When a Unit you can see casts a Spell, cancel it. It loses the Action (but not the Mana or Cooldown).

<Conjuration Specialization>.Effect: Whenever you spend any amount of Mana on a Conjuration Spell, gain Shielding equal to your Main Stat.

<Arcane Specialization>.Effect: Whenever you spend any amount of Mana on an Arcane Spell, shoot a magic missile at a target within 10 meters that instantly deals 1d4 Force Damage.

<Force Pulse>.Effect: All enemies within 10 meters must pass a Might Check or be knocked Prone and take 1d4 Force damage.

<Crystal Mage>.Effect:
You become a Crystal Mage.
All your spells that deal Fire, Cold or Force damage now deal a special type of damage, Crystal damage.
You also get the following Crystal Abilities.
<Crystal Mage>.Notes: Almost no creature has resistance or immunity specifically to Crystal damage.

<Battle Mage>.Effect:
While you have an even number of Mana points, your first melee weapon attack each turn deals an extra 1d6 Fire or Cold damage (your choice).
This can only happen if you're wearing Heavy Armor or a Shield.
You also get either Training in Shields, or one free Technique Feat of choice.

~Crystal Bolt~.Effect:
Attack a Unit exactly 6 meters away for 4d4 Crystal Damage.
The target and all Units within 1 meter of it also take Main Stat Crystal damage afterwards.

~Diamondize~.Effect:
Use when you would take damage.
Prevent the damage and become invulnerable and Stunned until the start of your next turn.
~Diamondize~.Notes: While invulnerable, you can not take damage and are immune to Crowd Control.

~Cutting Field~.Effect:
All units in a 90 degree, 6 meter long cone take 4d4 Crystal Damage.
Create spikes on all empty spaces (1x1 meter size each space).
Whenever a Unit steps on a spike space, it takes 1d4 Crystal Damage and shatters the spikes there.

<Spellcraft>.Effect:
When you cast a spell, you can apply this any of the following effects to it:
- For every 2 dice in its damage, roll 1 more
- If it targets an area, freely change the area to a 4x4 meter zone, 8x1 meter line or 5 meter 90* cone
- Change its damage type to any type, except True and Necrotic damage
- Change it's Check Stat to any other Stat (if it requires a Check)
- Swap Root, Cripple or Silence with any other of these
- Swap Slow, Prone or Pushing with any other of these (Push a target 2 meters away from you or from the zone center)
- Double its range
At any point, you can expend 1 Mana to reset the Cooldown of this Spell (Artificer - Spellcraft).

~Artificer~.Effect:
You own a set of Artificer's Tools, with which you can create potions, scrolls and other items.
Some of your class spells require you to use your Artificer's Tools (described below).
If they require you to spend Mana, that Mana becomes locked and can't be regained through any means, until the item created is used or destroyed.
For 1 Action, you can summon or vanish your Artificer's Tools.
Furthermore, you can use your Artificer's Tools for 10 minutes to make items shed light, emmit a sound or smell or paint surfaces in rough images or writing. The magical effects last for up to 8 hours.
Feel free to be creative with what you can do - the tools might do other small artificer tasks as well. Ask your DM!
~Artificer~.Notes:
Spells noted as 'Artificer' require you to use Artificer's Tools.
If you ever lose your Artificer's Tools, the price for a new set is 200 gold.
As usual, items created this way require 0.5 Actions to use.
Artificer potions do not count towards the potion limit cooldown.
Artificer's Tools's small tasks are a non-combat. You can't use them to deal damage, crowd control or heal.

~Artificer - Magic Scroll~.Effect:
Choose a Spell you can cast and spend Mana for it if it requires Mana.
You create a scroll containing that spell.
~Artificer - Magic Scroll~.Notes:
Remember that scrolls always take a Half-Action to use and can be used by anyone, including non-spellcasters.
Mana spent for the spell inside the scroll when creating the scroll does become locked as well.

~Artificer - Magic Elixir~.Effect:
Choose one of the following types of potions and create it
o Elixir of Healing - Heal for 2d6 + 1.
o Elixir of Strength - Attacks with 2-Handed weapons deal +2 damage, and attacks with 1-Handed weapons deal +1 damage (lasts 2 combat encounters).
o Elixir of Agility - Doubled movement speed.
o Elixir of Mana - Gain 1 Mana (if the user does not have Mana-based spellcasting, it has no effect).

<Master Specialization>.Effect: You have access to all Ability Lists in the game to Know Generic Abilities from. If a Spell costs has a Cooldown, it costs 1 Mana to cast.
<Master Specialization>.Notes: This refers to Bloodshed, Warfare, Arcane, Divine, etc. If a Spell requires a certain Level, you need that Level, as usual to Know it.

<Artificer - Magic Weapon>.Effect:
You conjure a special weapon out of magic.
Choose a type of weapon, and choose 2 of the following effects:
o +2 damage
o Damage can freely be converted to Fire/Cold/Shock (choose one)
o +2 meters move speed
o +5 health while wielding it
You can only have 1 Magic Weapon created at a time.
The Magic Weapon is automatically destroyed after 24 hours.

<Artificer - Golem>.Effect:
Choose an empty 2x2 meter space and deploy a Golem there that lasts until the end of your next Long Rest.
Choose if it's made of Clay, Metal or Flesh. It has different Abilities based on its material. You can find the Golem's stats in the Pets section.
The first time you summon a Golem after a Long Rest, it costs 1 Mana. Then, every Golem you summon costs 1 Mana more than the previous.
<Artificer - Golem>.Notes: The Golem has 0 initiative, so it usually takes its turn last in combat.

<Artificer - Autoturret>.Effect:
Choose an element: Fire, Cold, Shock or Force.
Choose an empty space to deploy an Autoturret of that element.
On your turn, you can freely make one attack with each Autoturret for 1d4 direct damage that ignores Defense and all resistances.
It has 5 Health, 7 Defense and fails all Checks.
<Artificer - Autoturret>.Notes: Cover from the turrets is applied normally.

<Artificer - Grenade>.Effect:
Throw a grenade at a target 5x5x5 meter area.
Choose one of the following effects. It applies to all Units caught in the area.
- Units must pass a Might Check or be Stunned
- Units must pass a Dexterity Check or take 6d4 Smash, Pierce or Slash damage (you choose) and be knocked away from the center of the area to closest space outside of the edge of the area. If a unit passes, it only takes half of that damage.
- The grenade explodes at the start of your next turn and deals 4d8 + Main Stat Fire damage (against Defense).
<Artificer - Grenade>.Notes: Alternatively, you create the Grenade out of combat and give it to an ally to use. If you do this, only one Grenade can be thrown during a combat. A second grenade has no effect (since it's magical by nature and draws from your magic power). This is considered an attack.

<Artificer - Magic Armor>.Effect:
You magically enchant a piece of armor until your next Long Rest.
Choose 2 of the following effects to apply to it:
- +1 Defense
- Choose a damage type. Wearer takes only 50% damage from that type.
- +2 meters Movement Speed, and the wearer can freely jump up to 2 meters (up or ahead; this still uses Movement).

~Divine Sense~.Effect:
You sense if there are Undead, Demons, Fiends or Celestials, or holy or unholy places or objects within 15 meters.
Thick walls obstruct your Divine Sense.

~Lay on Hands~.Effect:
You have (3 + Main Stat + Your Level) Holy points.
Using an action, you can expend any amount of Holy Points to heal a creature for that amount.
All your Holy Points replenish on Long Rests.

~Divine Smite~.Effect: Add 2d6 True damage to a melee attack (after you roll).

~Oath of Conquest~.Effect:
Every Worthy Enemy YOU defeat grants you 1d4 Holy Points.
You also gain Proficiency in Indimidation if you don't have it already.

~Impose~.Effect: A Unit must pass a Wisdom Check or be Feared. It has -2 to the roll if it's a Humanoid or Unholy.

<Pledge of Conquest>.Effect:
Ask a party member to join your cause and pledge his/her honor to you.
That person can use Divine Smite once per Long Rest.
It can also cast Lay on Hands using your Holy Points and always Knows the same Generic Divine Spells you Know at a time.
Additionally, Oath of Conquest also happens when that ally defeats a Worthy Enemy.
<Pledge of Conquest>.Notes:
You can only have one character who pledged for you.
The number of Holy Points of the ally does not increase.
If you ever change this Talent, the ally loses access to all things mentioned; it regains them when you get this Talent again.

<Retribution>.Effect:
You lose Lay on Hands, but gain access to the Eldritch Spell List. For you, if an Eldritch Spell costs 1 Mana, it instead has a Long Rest Cooldown (regardless of its normal Cooldown).
You can't cast Spells that cost more than 1 Mana.

<Fury Smite>.Effect: After an attack, deal 50% of the weapon damage done by the attack (dice plus any modifiers) to all enemies within 3 meters around the target (except you).
<Fury Smite>.Notes:
The damage of the attack counts as the dice rolled + any modifiers.
Using Divine Smite over an attack, for example, does not count as added to the weapon damage.
Damage done means damage inflicted after Defense and Resistances calculations.
Cover is applied normally for the AoE.

<Divine Reach>.Effect:
You empower yourself to make your melee weapons send fiery waves.
Your melee attacks have up to 3 meters range, deal 1d4 extra Damage and deal Fire Damage instead of Physical.
Lasts 1 minute.
Also, passively, you can now cast smites on ranged attacks (normally, you can only cast Smite on melee attacks).
<Divine Reach>.Notes:
Attacks like this count as either melee or ranged attacks, your choice. Targets still benefit from Cover, regardless.
Alternatively, if it makes sense for your character, the DM might allow it to deal Cold, Necrotic or Shock damage instead of Fire. Talk to your DM about this.

<Vengeance>.Effect:
When a Worthy Enemy dies in combat, get a Vengeance Counter.
Immediately when you get to 6 Vengeance Counters, gain 1 Mana or gain 4 Holy Points or reset the Cooldown of a Generic Spell you know (you choose).
You keep your Vengeance Counters even on Long Rests.

<Victory Smite>.Effect: After half (rounded down) of Worthy Enemies in a combat have been defeated, reset the Cooldown of Divine Smite or gain 7 Holy Points (you choose).

<Lay on Arms>.Effect: Use when you would take damage. Negate all the damage. After this, you can immediately freely use Lay on Hands without using Actions.

~Oath of Devotion~.Effect:
You are immune to diseases and curses.
When using Lay on Hands, instead of healing, you can expend 3 points to cure a minor disease or a poison.
You have 5 more maximum Holy Points.

~Divine Power~.Notes: You can't keep more than your maximum number of Holy Points through a Long Rest.

<Divine Blast>.Effect:
Make a Spell attack against a target and consume any number of Holy points. The attack deals 1d4 True Damage for each Holy Point used.
You can apply Smites to this attack.

<Shielding Hand>.Effect: Use after an ally (or yourself) takes damage. After that ally (or yourself) takes damage, it gains Shielding equal to the damage taken (after Defense and Resistances). The shield lasts up to 1 minute.

<Focused Smites>.Effect:
For 1 minute, your weapon attacks and offensive spells deal extra True damage and heal an ally within 6 meters of the target (or yourself).
Bonus Damage and Heal: 1 for 1-Handed weapons and Half-Action Spells, 2 for 2-Handed weapons and 1 Action Spells.
<Focused Smites>.Notes: If a spell doesn't deal damage, just instantly deal the Focused Smites damage to the target.

<Devotion Aura>.Effect: All allies on your team have +1 Defense if their Defense is lower than 3.
<Devotion Aura>.Notes: Does not stack with itself multiple times (from multiple Paladins).

<Broken Hearts>.Requirement: Only usable if all your Generic Abilities that have a Cooldown are on Cooldown
<Broken Hearts>.Effect:
All Humanoids within 4 meters of you must pass a Wisdom Check or take 3d4 True Damage and be Stunned.
They take half of that damage if they pass.

<Improved Faith Casting>.Effect:
Your Generic Faith Spells are amplified:
Invigorate now heals for an extra 1d4.
Searing Smite deals an extra 1d4 damage (both on hit and delayed).
Vindication always heals for an additional of 1d4.

~Oath of Protection~.Effect:
When another ally is attacked (after the roll), dash next to that ally.
The attack is now targeted on you instead of the ally.

~Stand Behind~.Effect:
You stand out for allies adjacent to you.
Enemy ranged attacks against other allies next to you have Cover.
~Stand Behind~.Notes: Nothing happens if an ally adjacent to you already has Cover. Next to you means 1 meter away (a square immediately next to you; works diagonally).

<Divine Rain>.Effect:
You prepare to take lethal blow.
If you would drop to 0 Health until the start of your next turn, you remain instead at 1 Health and can't take damage until the start of your next turn.
When this happens, divine rays strike all enemies within 3 meters of you, and they all take 1d6 True damage.

<Reckoning>.Effect:
Make a spell attack on a target for 2d10 Force damage.
It must pass a Might Check or be Crippled and pushed away from you until the distance between you and the target is 6 meters.
If it stops in a wall or another enemy, it takes another 1d10 Force damage.

<Consacrated Zone>.Effect:
The area in a 5 meter diameter circle around you becomes Consacrated.
While inside the area, your and all allies' Divine, Mysticism, Nature and Class Spells (not Abilities) have their dice tier increased by 1.
Does not apply to Passive Spells.
<Consacrated Zone>.Notes:
Increasing dice by 1 tier means, for example, d6 become d8, or d10 become d12.
D12's and d20's don't increase.
Class Spells are Spells given by the character's class.

<Sanctuary Zone>.Effect:
Declare a 7x7 area.
All units in the area take only 50% damage (after Defense).
Lasts until the start of your next turn's next turn.

<Oath of Revenge>.Effect:
After you use Oath of Protection, you can immediately make an attack (freely) with a 1-Handed Melee Weapon on the attacker.
This attack has 3 meters range and deals True damage.
You can apply Smites to it.

~Proficiency in Stealth~.Effect: Add your Level to all Dexterity Checks for hiding, remaining quiet, moving silently, blending in a crowd, etc.

~Proficiency in Acrobatics~.Effect: Add your Level to all Dexterity Checks for jumping, climbing, fitting through gaps, maintaining balance and other acrobatic moves.

~Proficiency in Sleight of Hand~.Effect: Ad your Level to all Checks for fine finger movements (e.g. picking pockets, searching a dumpster, sleeve tricks, etc)

~Proficiency in Deception~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for lying, fooling, concealing information, faking emotions, etc.

~Proficiency in Dungeoneering~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for navigating dungeons and identifying traps, secret doors, dungeon monsters, etc.

~Ambush~.Effect:
If you start your turn Hidden, your first attack deals 1d8 extra damage.
When Ambushing, you can also spend as much Mana as you want.
That attack gains 1d8 extra damage for each Mana spent (on top of the 1d8).
Ambush can only happen once per turn.
~Ambush~.Notes:
Your Specialization will give you extra ways to Ambush.
You can't stack 2 Ambushes at the same time, obviously.

~Hide~.Effect:
When combat starts, if you have Cover, you start as Hidden.
While Hidden, you can skip your turn.
Then, you can unhide and start your turn whenever you like (even during enemies' turns).
If you did this, when your turn ends, you are no longer hidden.
~Hide~.Notes:
Essentially, you can interrupt another Unit's turn, put that unit on pause, and start your turn. When your turn ends, the Unit resumes its turn.
If you want to start during an enemy's turn, you do so when they declare they want to do something or after they finish doing something.
~Hide~.Name: ~Hide~

~Backstab~.Effect: When you Flank an enemy, Ambush is applied.

~Agile Hand~.Notes: Fleeing is when you move away from an enemy's melee attack range; if you are Fleeing, all your actions have Cover.

~Fool's Coin~.Effect:
After you spend Mana on Ambush, choose one of the rolled dice of the attack (including the base weapon dice and base ambush dice). Gain that many Gold Tokens.
Gold Tokens are an imaginary currency.
When in a town or city, you convert all Gold Tokens to actual gold coins (1 Gold Token for 10 Gold) (this is done on a Long Rest).
~Fool's Coin~.Notes: Lore-wise, as a Thief you steal successfully in a city when converting tokens, while preparing and gaining momentum for it in combat.

<Payback Shot>.Effect:
A Unit within 2 meters must pass a Dexterity Check or be Stunned.
For every 2 Gold Tokens you spent, increase the Grade of this by 1.

<Arcane Trickster>.Effect:
You can now cast spells!
You permanently know 3 Spells from the Arcane and Conjuration Spell Lists.
Fool's Coin now also applies when spending Mana on a Spell.
You can change these Spells when you Long Rest.
<Arcane Trickster>.Upgrade: You learn 1 additional Ability from those Spell Lists at Levels 3, 5, 7 and 9.
<Arcane Trickster>.Notes: You lose access to these Spells if you change this Talent.

<Way of Fooling>.Effect: Your Charisma is increased by 2, (up to a maximum of 4).

<Whiplash>.Cooldown: Long Rest, otherwise it costs 1 Mana
<Whiplash>.Effect:
Throw a whiplash at a grabbable point within 6 meters.
Pull yourself to a target point.
<Whiplash>.Notes: Requires a Whiplash item, which can be bought for 100 gold.

<Thief Shock Wire>.Range: 6 meters to end in line of sight
<Thief Shock Wire>.Effect:
Deploy a Shock Tripwire of up to 5 meters long between 2 obstacles.
When a Unit passes through the tripwire, it takes 1d8 Shock Damage and must pass a Dexterity Check with -3 or be Rooted.
A Unit can see the tripwire only if it has 3 or more Wisdom.
<Thief Shock Wire>.Notes:
Each end of the wire must be attached to something solid and static.
You can make use of walls, obstacles, etc.
Requires a Special Tripwire Set which can be bought for 200 gold.

<Blade Tempest>.Effect:
You throw out 8 boomerang blades: one towards each direction (up, up-right, right, etc).
Each blade travels 4 meters and stops in that space (can occupy the same space as another Unit).
Each blade deals 2d6 direct Slash damage (not against Defense) to all Units it passes through.
At the end of your next turn, the blades return to you.
Then, again, each blade deals 2d6 direct Slash damage (not against Defense) to all Units it passes through.
<Blade Tempest>.Notes: Requires 8 special blades, which can be bought for a total of 240 gold.

<Poisoned Weapons>.Effect:
You coat up to 2 weapons in different poisons that last for 8 hours.
Choose 2 weapons, and choose a different poison to apply for each:
- Deathly Venom: Deals 1d10 extra Poison damage to targets with more than 50% Health; then the target becomes immune to this poison for 1 minute.
- Necrotic Toxin: The attack's target becomes Slowed and can't regain Health for 1 minute
- Phosphorus: The target can't benefit from Cover for 1 minute (and this attack ignores Cover)
- Weakening Poison: The target can only do 1 Attack on their next turn
<Poisoned Weapons>.Notes:
Remember to specify which weapon you are attacking to.
Requires a Poisoner's Kit which can be bought for 200 gold on the black market. If you're in a tight scenario, the DM might let you use monster blood or gather herbs for a 1-time use of this Ability.

~Isolated~.Effect:
When you attack a Unit, and there is no other Unit adjacent to you or to that enemy (except you), the attack gains Ambush.
If you are already Ambushing the target, the attack gains an additional 1d8 damage.

~Planned Assassination~.Effect:
You plan an attack for 1 minute.
Your next attack on that target deals 2d6 + 2 Poison damage.
Planned Assassination fails if your Line of Sight to the target is broken until you attack it.
~Planned Assassination~.Notes: The Mana is spent the moment you declare Planned Assassination.

<Take Out>.Effect:
A Unit within 1 meter must pass a Dexterity Check or be put to Sleep for 1 minute.
If it fails, you gain the Action back.
<Take Out>.Downside:
You must be hiding to use Take Out, and the target must be Isolated.
This ability unhides you!

<Poison Master>.Effect:
Using ingredients costing 35 Gold, you are able to create a few drops of Drinkable Poison.
Someone ingesting them takes 1d12 Poison damage instantly.
Combining multiple instances of Drinkable Poison increases its damage by 1d12 for each Drinkable Poison combined.
The poison loses its effect after 72 hours.

<Shadowstep>.Effect:
If you are covered in shadow, choose another point covered in shadow up to 6 meters away.
Instantly teleport to that place.

<Death Mark>.Effect:
Mark a Unit you can see.
Whenever YOU deal damage to it until your next turn, remember the damage done.
At the start of your next turn, the mark bursts and the Unit takes directly 50% of the damage it has taken in this time period.

~Savagery~.Effect: Attacks on Units that have 50% or less health gain Ambush.

~Parry~.Effect: Halve the damage of a weapon attack you receive (after the roll, before subtracting Defense).

<10% Luck>.Effect: Once per turn, when you roll a 1 on an attack die, you can reroll that die.

<Cheap Tricks>.Effect: A Unit within 3 meters must pass a Dexterity Check or be Blinded for 2 turns.

<Quickfire>.Effect:
Perform an attack with a 1-Handed Ranged weapon.
This attack ignores Cover and has no penalty if you're Blinded.
This attack does not trigger attacks of oportunity and can be used in melee range without penalty.

<Combat Shock Wire>.Range: 6 meters to end in line of sight
<Combat Shock Wire>.Effect:
Whenever you spend one or more Mana, freely deploy a Shock Tripwire of up to 5 meters long between 2 obstacles.
When a Unit passes through the tripwire, it takes 1d8 Shock Damage and must pass a Dexterity Check with -3 or be Rooted.
A Unit can see the tripwire only if it has 3 or more Wisdom.
<Combat Shock Wire>.Notes:
Each end of the wire must be attached to something solid and static.
You can make use of walls, obstacles, etc.
Requires a Special Tripwire Set which can be bought for 200 gold.

<Swing Thing>.Effect:
Use when a Unit within 6 meters becomes Rooted, Stunned or knocked Prone (you must have line of sight to it).
Deal 1d8 Pierce damage to it and push it up to 3 meters in any direction.
<Swing Thing>.Notes:
Requires a Whiplash item for pushing towards you or to a side, which can be bought for 100 gold.
For pushing away from you, requires a gun or crossbow of any type.

~Proficiency in Occultism~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for knowing about demons or undead, rituals, myths or cryptids, black magic, etc.

~Animal Spirit~.Effect:
Choose one of the 4 animal spirits. You gain an Ability depending on your Spirit Animal.
Bear grants you Bear's Roar, Wolf grants you Wolf's Leap, Eagle grants you Eagle's Sight and Owl grants you Owl's Foresight.
~Animal Spirit~.Notes: You can customize the looks of your animals for aesthetic purposes (e.g. pretend it's another animal). For example, if you want a tiger as an animal spirit, you can choose Wolf, but, cosmetically/aesthetically, it's a tiger.

~Bear's Roar~.Effect: All enemies within 3 meters of you must pass a Charisma Check or take 1d6 Psychic damage and be Crippled.

~Wolf's Leap~.Effect:
Leap at a target up to 3 meters away.
The target takes 1d6 Bleed damage at the end of each of your turns for 1 minute.

~Eagle's Sight~.Effect:
You have Maximum Initiative every encounter.
All your ranged attacks have an extra 3 meters range.
Your Counter Check Grade is increased by 1.

~Owl's Foresight~.Effect:
Use when an enemy you see casts a spell (non-naturally).
The spell is cancelled and the enemy loses the Action for it.

~Path of the Berserker~.Effect:
Your total Defense is always halved (even with buffs), rounded down, no matter what armor type you are wearing.
Your total Health is increased by 50% (buffs are not increased).
Your Reserve Health Pool does not increase with your Health.
~Path of the Berserker~.Notes: Only your Health calculated from your Race Health + Might + Health per Level is increased by 50%. Anything from Abilities is not included.

~Bloodlust~.Effect: Add damage to an attack equal to 25% of your missing Health (rounded up).
~Bloodlust~.Notes: This is not considered a Spell.

<Reincarnation>.Effect:
Use at any time (e.g. when a Unit falls to 0 Health).
Stabilize an Fallen Unit or revive a Unit that died recently (12 hours maximum).
This puts the Unit at Health equal to its own Main Stat * 4.
You can do this on yourself if you are dead.
This cures Exhaustion.

<Spirit Draw>.Effect:
Aniother ally can channel for 10 minutes to draw power from your soul.
That ally can use Bloodlust once and use your spirit animal Ability once.
Lasts until either of you cancel it, or until either's next Long Rest.
An ally can't draw your soul more than once per Long Rest.
An ally can't keep your soul drawn through a Long Rest.

<Summon Animal Spirit>.Effect:
You summon your Spirit Animal next to you for up to 10 minutes!
Check out your animal's stats in the Animals section, Spirit Animals category.
Additionally, you can see through your Pet's eyes if you choose so.
Your animal has stats depending on its species.
Your pet takes its turn at the same time as you do, and always has the same initiative as yours.
Your pet has 1 Action per turn.
Your pet can make normal Checks using using its own Stats.
Your pet will not stray more than 30 meters away from you in hostile territory.
All pets have the Pet Attack ability.

<Jotunn>.Effect:
You grow to the size of a giant and become Large.
Your normal Melee attacks hit all Units within 1 meter of the target for the same damage, without the Stat modifier (against Defense) (e.g. you don't add your Might or Dexterity to the secondary targets).
You are immune to being Slowed, Rooted, Crippled, Dazed and to Hard Terrain.
You gain 10 Shielding.
Lasts 1 minute.

<Earthshattering Wave>.Effect: All units in a 9x3 line must pass a Might Check or be Stunned. If they pass, they become Dazed instead.
<Earthshattering Wave>.Notes:
There is no escape!
Cover is applied normally.

<Ruining Shout>.Effect:
Damages all Enemies within 4 meters of you.
Deals 1d6 Psychic damage (directly) for each 1 meter to the target (up to 4d6).
Roll 4d6 at the same time, and choose which dice affect the units closer.

~Spirit Bond~.Effect:
Touch another ally.
Whenever either of you makes a Check, add the higher bonus from either of you instead of the normal Check bonus.
You can do this once per Long Rest, and lasts until your next Long Rest.
~Spirit Bond~.Notes: This does apply to Proficiencies - if your bonded ally has Proficiency in something, you also add the ally's Level, as it would normally make sense.

~Mind Sight~.Effect:
A Unit you can clearly see must pass a Wisdom Check or be Blinded and take 3d6 damage, or half of that if it passes.
Then, if you succeeded, you can then see through the target's eyes until you make another action or move.
If the target is unaware and it rolls 7 or less (total), it doesn't notice what just happened.
~Mind Sight~.Notes:
You can choose not to deal the damage for this ability and not to Blind the target.
You see more and more blurry as the target gets farther away. At 10 kilometers, the spell breaks.

<Mind Link>.Effect:
Establish a mind connection with a willing ally.
Until your next Long Rest, you can talk to eachother telepathically.
Additionally, the ally can do Mind Sight once until your Long Rest.

<Dream Walk>.Effect:
A Unit must pass a Wisdom Check or fall Asleep for 2 turns.
Alternatively, you can use Dream Walk on an already sleeping target to alter their dreams to your liking.
<Dream Walk>.Notes: A Sleeping Unit wakes up if it takes damage or other Crowd Control.

<Strong Spirited>.Effect:
Spirit Bond now works for Attack bonuses and Counter Check Grades too.
For your every 3rd Spell you cast that has a Long Rest cooldown, if it's single target Spell, the target must pass a Wisdom Check or be Dazed.

<Psyche Tether>.Effect:
Place a tether on 2 Units within 10 meters of you.
The next time one of them takes damage, the other one takes the damage (directly) as well as True damage.
<Psyche Tether>.Notes:
If both are damaged at the same time, this only applies once and you choose which takes the damage of the other.
The extra damage of Smites, Ambush, etc count over an attack counts as the same damage source.
If another case is ambiguous, the DM makes the choice if it counts.

~Spirit Guides~.Effect:
You are in constant communion with certain spirits.
These spirits can be the souls of people you knew who died, spirits of other animals, etc.
These spirits will sometimes guide your way and aid you in your endeavors.
After every Long Rest, roll 1d6 and remember what you rolled.
These dice are called Guide Dice.
You can freely consume one Guide Dice and add it to any Check you or your party makes.
At levels 2, 5 and 8, you gain one more Guide Die.

~Hex and Curse~.Effect:
Declare either an ally (or yourself) or an enemy within 6 meters.
If it's an enemy, it must pass a Wisdom Check or have all its damage dice downgraded 1 tier for 1 minute.
If it's an ally, it must pass a Wisdom Check to be healed for 1d12, or half of that if it fails.
Downgrading can stack (you can downgrade an enemy's dice multiple times).
~Hex and Curse~.Notes:
Downgrading dice by 1 tier means, for example, d6 become d4, or d12 become d10.
D4's and d20's don't decrease.
If you target an Epic Monster, the tier downgrade happens to its first turn only.

<Voodoo Magic>.Effect:
A Unit within 6 meters makes a Wisdom Check.
If it fails, it takes 2d6 Psychic damage at the start of your turn for 1 minute and for its next turn, you can choose that enemy's actions as long as it would seem reasonable to that enemy (decide with your DM).
Epic Monsters can not be controlled; they only take the damage.
<Voodoo Magic>.Notes: For example, you can make a goblin run or recklessly attack one of your party members. But you can't make a guard jump off a cliff, because that's not what it would normally do.

<Incorporeal Form>.Effect:
You become a bodyless soul for up to 8 hours and enter a willing ally.
While inside the ally's body, you can communicate with them mentally, and only they can see you.
You can slightly peek outside of their body, and move your arms, upper body and head as if you were a ghost originating from that ally's body.
o You can't move yourself, but you always move with that ally.
o You can't do any physical actions (because you are basically a ghost and can't touch anything or anyone).
o You can cast spells as normal. 
o You follow your own Initiative in combat.
o You can't take damage from external sources, but you feel every body sensation that ally feels.
You can freely exit their body and revert back to your physical self using 0 Actions.

<Bomboclaat>.Effect:
You gain 1 more Guide Die.
You can now do the following with Guide Dice:
- Add to another ally's damage roll
- Subtract from an enemy's damage roll
- Add to another ally's Combat Check
- Subtract from an enemy's Combat Check
You can only use 1 Guide Die at a time.

<Dead Hands>.Effect:
Choose a 3x3 meter zone.
Undead hands appear in that zone and make it Hard Terrain.
At the start of your next turn, use one of your Guide Dice to summon that many Zombies wherever you choose in that zone.
They take their turn the same time as you and you can command them to do whatever you want.
They have 4 Speed, 1 Health, 3 Defense and fail all Checks.
Each can attack for 1d4 - 1 direct Necrotic damage (ignores Defense).
Zombies last up to 10 minutes.

<Bone Mass>.Effect:
Spend one Guide Die and declare a square area.
The diameter of the area is equal to the spent Guide Die.
Sharp bones occupying 1x1 meters each grow from the area.
When a Unit steps on a Sharp Bone, it directly takes 1d8 Pierce Damage and loses 1 meter of its remaining speed.
The bone then shatters.

~Power Tap~.Effect:
Cast an ability one of your Allies has (with that ability's Actions and Costs and your modifiers).
If it costs Mana, you must spend its Mana.
~Power Tap~.Notes: Does not work on Passives. The Ability must have 0, a Half-Action or 1 Actions cost.

~Fey Patron~.Effect:
Your lord is a higher fey creature.
Choose one more Race Ability from your Race's choices.
~Fey Patron~.Notes:
Yes, you will have 2 Race Abilities from the Race Ability choices.
Lore-wise, the Fey Patron enhances you magically, mutates your arcane flow and transforms you into an unordinarily adapted person.
If you are a Human, pick one more first Race Ability from another Race.
If you are a Dragonborn, your Breath has both chosen shapes simultanuously.

~Celestial Patron~.Effect: Your lord is a celestial being, who lives in a higher plane. You gain Life Cycle.
~Celestial Patron~.Notes: The gift of Life Cycle is granted to you by your patron. Use it well. Withhold the balance.

~Old God Patron~.Effect:
Your lord is an old, slumbering god.
You can pick a Racial Ability from any other race and have it permanently (not from the Race Ability Choices, but from the Starting Abilities).
~Old God Patron~.Notes: Eldritch thoughts flow through your mind, infecting you with strange abilities acquired in unfathomable ways.

<Life Cycle>.Effect: Heal a Unit within 10 meters for up to 10 Health from their remaining Reserve Health Pool.

~Demon Patron~.Effect:
Your lord is a powerful demon.
You gain Soul Drain.
~Demon Patron~.Notes: Through every soul drained, your demon lord feeds, and in return, grants you even more power.

<Soul Drain>.Effect:
Deal 7 Necrotic damage to a creature (directly, not against Defense).
If it dies, you get the Mana back and heal for 5 Health.

~Sentient Weapon~.Effect:
You have a Hexblade Weapon, inside which your patron's avatar lies, either possessing the weapon, being trapped inside it or using it as a means of communication with you.
Pick any weapon type (e.g. Shortsword, Longbow, Pike, etc), and it becomes your Hexblade Weapon.
You can customize your weapon's personality, voice, the way it looks. Talk to your DM about this.
You are automatically considered trained in your Hexblade Weapon.

~Hexblade~.Effect: After you cast an offensive spell, your next attack with your Hexblade Weapon deals +1d6 damage.
~Hexblade~.Upgrade: The bonus damage becomes 1d8 at Level 5.
~Hexblade~.Notes: Offensive means that it deals damage or applies hard Crowd Control (anything better than Slow and creating Hard Terrain).

<Shapeshifting Weapon>.Effect: Instantly change the type of weapon of your Hexblade.

<Hexstaff>.Effect:
Your Hexblade Ability is replaced by Hexstaff:
After you attack with a weapon, your next offensive spell has +1 Counter Check Grade and deals +1d6 damage.
<Hexstaff>.Upgrade: The bonus damage becomes 1d8 at Level 5.

<Doublehex>.Effect:
You now have 1 more Hexblade Weapon, of any kind. The same patron or another one is possessing your second weapon.
At any time, you can vanish or resummon either weapon.

<Hungering Weapon>.Effect: When YOU drop a Worthy Enemy to 0 Health, gain an extra Half-Action this turn and Shielding equal to your Main Stat.

<Spell Tap>.Effect: Every Worthy Combat, when you drop to 0 Mana, reset the Cooldown of Power Tap and gain Shielding equal to your Main Stat.

<Somatic Pulse>.Effect:
Count the Units within 3 meters of you (except you).
They are all attacked for 2d6 + (the number of Units) True damage (against Defense).
<Somatic Pulse>.Notes: E.g. if this affects 2 Units, it deals 3d6. If it affects 3 Units, it deals 4d6. 4 Units - 5d6. And so on.

~Summon Familiar~.Effect:
You conjure a ritual for 1 hour.
The first time you cast this ritual, you summon a familiar which becomes yours.
You can choose what your familiar looks like, assuming it is a small creature.
Also, choose an element which is bound to it: Fire, Water, Frost, Arcane, Thunder, Earth, Wind, Light or Darkness. That becomes your Familiar's Element.
Your familiar comes with a name that the GM decides.
The familiar doesn't take turns on its own, but at the same time as you.
On your turn, your familiar can use its own movement to move, but you must spend your own Actions for it to take actions.
If your familiar goes more than 30 meters away from you, it becomes unsummoned.
If it dies, it becomes unsummoned.
You can always summon it back with this Ability.
The stat block for the Familiar is on the Pets and Animals page.
~Summon Familiar~.Notes:
You can communicate with your Familiar telepathically.
The Familiar can be classified as a demon, undead, celestial, monstrosity, etc (but not beast or humanoid).

~Familiar Pet Attack~.Effect:
The familiar melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d12 + Main Stat damage (of your pet's elemental type).
~Familiar Pet Attack~.Notes: The attack is against target's Defense, of course.

~Familiar Feats~.Effect:
You also have access to the Familiar Feats.
You can choose one Familiar Feat to get for free.

<Tongues>.Effect:
You speak all Common and Wild languages.
You have +1 Counter Check Grade.

<Impmaster>.Effect: When you get this Talent, gain 1 Feat.

<Patron Aspect>.Effect:
You take on the shape or a being from your patron's plane until the end of your next turn.
You have +2 Defense, +2 Main Stat, and your Generic Spells require no mana to cast.
After you cast a Generic Spell for free, it goes on a Long Rest Cooldown.

<Dual Summonation>.Effect:
Summon 2 Dual-Imps at any spaces within 6 meters and choose a target.
These 2 imps will cast Chase Bolt and chase their target to death. Otherwise, they don't move from their spot.
They last for 10 minutes or until thet target is defeated or they can't attack it.
Imps take their turn immediately after you.
See the Pets section for the Dual-Imp stats.
<Dual Summonation>.Notes:
Imps become unsummoned at the start of their turn if the target dies or it becomes untargetable or invisible; Imps will chase around corners, though. Imps don't care about Cover; they attack anyway.
Imps aren't very smart, they don't employ tactics.

<Patron Avatar>.Effect:
You summon an Avatar of your patron.
While the Avatar is summoned, you can't move, except with teleportation Spells.
You and the Avatar share Actions and you must use at least a Half-Action with it every turn, otherwise it becomes unsummoned.
The Avatar can't take damage or be directly Crowd Controlled, but all Crowd Control you would take is redirected to it.
See the Avatar's Stats and Abilities in the Pets sections.
Lasts up to 1 minute or until you are Stunned, Silenced, put to Sleep, etc or physically moved from place.
<Patron Avatar>.Notes: You can cancel the summon at any point on your turn. The Avatar also ends if it goes more than 30 meters away from you.

~Proficiency in Athletics~.Effect: Add your Level to all Might Checks for using your physical strength (e.g. lifting, breaking by hand, etc).

~Advanced Flank~.Effect:
The first time you Flank-Attack an enemy every turn, the attack gains +1d4 damage.
Also, your attacks Flank an enemy if they are pinned against a wall or an obstacle as well.
~Advanced Flank~.Note:
Flanking is when you melee-attack an enemy, and an ally of yours is directly behind the enemy.
Also, instead of an ally being behind the enemy, your attacks count as Flanking even if there is a wall or another obstacle directly behind them.

~Upper Hand~.Effect:
Your first attack you make before you move in a turn counts as if it is Flanking, regardless if it would be Flanking normally or not.
If you are wielding a 1-Handed weapon, when you make an attack of opportunity, you can make 2 attacks of opportunity instead (with that weapon).

~Overpower~.Effect: Gain a Half-Action more this turn.

<Might Over Magic>.Effect:
Choose an Advanced spell from the Elemental spell list that deals damage.
You can cast that spell once per Long Rest.
That spell becomes a physical version of itself.
Instead of using magic to cast that spell, you use your body/weapons/tools.
Come up with a description of how it works (see notes).
The damage of that spell becomes Slash, Smash or Pierce, whichever makes sense.
It is not considered a Spell.
<Might Over Magic>.Notes:
E.g. Scorching Rays - you shoot 3 arrows with your bow (Pierce damage).
E.g. Frost Nova - you smash the ground with such force that it damages and slows units around you (Smash damage).
Be creative!

<Weaponmaster>.Effect:
When you get this, choose one weapon type.
You have that weapon effect too, no matter what weapon you are using.
You can the weapon type you always know on a Long Rest.

<Into the Fray>.Effect:
When combat starts, determine which side is your Allied Side and which is the Enemy Side of the battlefield. Each side has a direction (Allied Direction and Enemy Direction).
If you end your turn more to the Allied Direction than you started, you gain 4 Shielding until the start of your next turn.
If you end your turn more to the Enemy Direction than you started, your first attack next turn deals 1d6 extra damage.

<Glory Run>.Effect:
When combat starts, a Glory Point appears behind the furthermost Enemy from you that you can see.
If you touch the Glory Point, heal for 20% of your total Health and all Enemies you can see must pass a Charisma Check or be Crippled.
The Glory Point then disappears.
<Glory Run>.Notes: The Glory Point is not a physical thing. It's merely a concept (a point).

<Ruining Throw>.Effect:
Throw your weapon at a target and attack it (with the weapon's standard, non-throw damage).
Before applying the damage, the attack destroys all Shielding on the target and removes all buffs on it.
The target is unable to trigger "on roll", can't gain Shielding and can't benefit from Buffs until they spend 1 Action to recover.
<Ruining Throw>.Notes:
Your weapon lands at the nearest space to the target (and you should probably pick it up with a Half-Action).
"On roll" refers to effects like "if it rolls 10 on a d10, the attack deals 1d10 extra damage".
Buffs are all effects that improve the target; even passive effects like auras or passive stats from abilities are negated.
You don't need Training in Throwning and this attack counts as a regular melee attack.

~Solid Defense~.Effect:
Whenever you are attacked (after damage), your Defense is reduced by 1 (if it's more than 0).
Every Long Rest, your Defense resets to its base value and is increased by +1 on top of it.

~Obliterate~.Effect:
Deal bonus damage on top of an attack equal to your current Defense (minimum 0).
Reset your Defense.

<Protect the Meek>.Effect: When an ally within 3 meters of you is targeted by a ranged attack, you become its target instead.

<Bashing Charge>.Effect:
Move 3 meters in a straight line, then choose a target near you.
That target takes 1d8 damage and it must pass a Might Check or be Stunned.

~Onslaught~.Effect: Whenever YOU kill a worthy enemy, heal for 1d6.

~Reckless Attack~.Effect: After you land an attack, you can deal 2d6 damage to you and also add that damage to the attack.

~Undying Rage~.Effect: Taking damage that would kill you leaves you at 1 Health instead.

<Heartbeat Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 damage.
Enter a Heart Trance for 1 minute.
While in Heart Trance, you take 50% less damage from all non-Physical combat damage (except from your own abilities).
When Heart Trance ends, heal for 2d6.
<Heartbeat Trance>.Notes: You can activate this as a Reaction when you would take damage.

<Rage Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 damage.
Until the end of your next turn, you are immune to Stuns, Slows, Roots, Cripples and being knocked Prone.
Your attacks while in Rage Trance have an extra +1 damage to all attacks.
When Rage Trance ends, heal for 2d6.
<Rage Trance>.Notes: You can activate this as a Reaction when you would be Crowd Controlled.

<Battle Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 damage.
